question.text:
In the given set of statements regarding the tissues found in animals, determine the option that has the correct combination of true and false statements.

I. Cartilage is present in tip of nose and between the bodies of adjacent vertebrae.

II. Adhering junctions along with cementing cells together also facilitate the cells to communicate with each other by connecting the plasma membranes of adjoining cells.

III. Compound epithelium covers the moist surface of buccal cavity, pharynx and lining of ducts of salivary glands.

IV. Striated muscle fibre is thin elongated with point ends and multiple nuclei

options.text: I: True, II: False, III: True, IV: False
I: True, II: True, III: True, IV: False
I: False, II: False, III: True, IV: False
I: True, II: False, III: False, IV: True

solution.text: I. Cartilage is present in the tip of nose, outer ear joints, between adjacent bones of the vertebral column, limbs and hands in adults. II. Adhering junctions perform cementing to keep neighbouring cells together. III. Compound epithelium cover the dry surface of the skin, the moist surface of buccal cavity, pharynx, inner lining of ducts of salivary glands and of pancreatic ducts.IV. Striated muscle fibre is thin elongated with blunt ends and multiple nuclei.
